HEADS-UP to others! If you've already installed and patched another Adobe application (such as Photoshop), installing Illustrator seems to revert the amtlib.DLL file found in Adobe Bridge to the original. I noticed and corrected it before I actually ran any Adobe applications so I don't know what the result would be if you ran Illustrator or something else without re-patching the DLL in Adobe Bridge.

That aside, I followed the instructions for the DLL files and swapped the PNG graphics, double checked with Adobe Tool 2.1 to make sure my hosts file was patched, and everything went just fine. Rebooted, and everything is still working perfectly.

@mtrz i was having the same problem.. before installing, go into your device manager, then network adapters, and right click/disable it so that when you start the installation, adobe thinks you don't have a way to validate your adobe ID so it doesn't even ask during setup.

I am surprised so many people haven't responded to this yet.

If you go to the top of this PirateBay site and go to the "Files:" in the Torrent Description (next to the flag image on top, below ADOBE ILLUSTRATOR CS6 [thethingy]), if you click the "1" it will say that the file you are downloading is an .exe (ADOBE ILLUSTRATOR CS6  [thethingy].exe).

When I finished downloading the file was labeled as a "file" and when I clicked it it asked which program to use to install. The problem when you downloaded it, you probably lost the .exe extension. 

In order to turn it into a valuable file you will need to go to the downloaded file and add .exe to it (change to ADOBE ILLUSTRATOR CS6  [thethingy].exe). This will make the file usable.

This may happen sometimes when downloading torrents. So if this happens again just go to the files list and fine out what file extension it is (.avi, exe, etc.) and correct it.
